The Prime Minister said: ''I am very pleased that Craig Oliver is to become the new Director of Communications at 10 Downing Street. Craig has formidable experience as a broadcast journalist. He will do an excellent job in explaining and communicating the Government's programme. Craig Oliver said: ''I'm delighted to be joining David Cameron and his team at such an exciting and challenging time. ''It's difficult to leave the BBC after a fascinating few years

administration, possibly replacing Robert Gates as defense secretary, Colin Powell said he is not interested in a government role.
